results.title: Until the end of the world
results.creator_credit: Wim Wenders, Kim Vecara, Argos Films, Road Movies Filmproduktion and Village Roadshow Pictures
results.brief_description: Wim Wenders combines his many obsessions in this bizarre and intricate science-fiction tale spanning three continents. An outstanding Solveig Dommartin plays a woman who is searching for a stranger (William Hurt) to whom she is attracted. All she knows is that he is undertaking a dangerous mission for his scientist father (Max Von Sydow). Her search takes her through an end-of-the millineum Europe and Asia in which technology and consumerism has run riot. She traces the stranger to Australia where beneath the desert soil, a group of Aborigine and European scientists are hoping to create a society which will save mankind. Combining exceptional graphics, a film noir palette and a metaphysical reflection on alienation and colonial exploitation, “Until The End of the World” is a difficult but exhilerating film. Co-starring Jeanne Moreau and Ernie Dingo and featuring a stunning soundtrack including U2, Lou Reed, Nick Cave, Neneh Cherry, Can and REM.

results.title: Looking for Mr. Goodbar (E)
results.creator_credit: Richard Brooks, Freddie Fields and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Judith Rossner, Theresa Dunn (Dianne Keaton) is a “nice Catholic girl”. By day she is a compassionate teacher of deaf children, but by night, she seeks the uninvolved sexual experiences to be found by cruising the Singles Bar scene. Keaton’s portrayal of Theresa is powerful; vacillating between fragility, insecurity, and obsession on the one hand, and confidence, manipulation and hedonism on the other. Theresa is on a journey to escape her family and her upbringing in order to find herself and her “Mr Goodbar”. Ultimately, the journey is both unfulfilling and unenlightened as Theresa makes the wrong choice one night and pays for it with her life. “Looking for Mr. Goodbar” redefined female roles, as it dealt with a central character who was neither the stereotypical “tramp” or “lady” of traditional female roles.

results.title: Mediterraneo
results.creator_credit: Gabriele Salvatores, Gianni Minervini, Vittorio Cecchi Gori, Mario Cecchi Gori and Penta Films
results.brief_description: A delightful comedy which won an Academy Award for Best Foreign Film in 1992. Eight misfit Italian soldiers are stranded on an idyllic Greek island during World War II. The island is solely populated by women and soon the soldiers are seduced by the beauty of the island and its inhabitants. The ravages and horrors of war are forgotten as the young men embrace a warm and peaceful life. Eventually however, their sojourn in paradise is over and they must confront the end of the war and return to their native land. Italian dialogue with English subtitles.

results.title: Living free
results.creator_credit: Jack Couffer, Paul Radin, Carl Foreman and Columbia
results.brief_description: The sequel to “Born free” continues the adventures of Joy and George Adamson. Elsa the lioness brings her three cubs out of the wilderness to the couple who raised her. When Elsa suddenly dies, the cubs who cannot fend for themselves, attack domestic animals to survive before disappearing into the wild. The Adamson’s launch a desperate attempt to find the young lions and bring them to the safety of the game reserve. Starring Susan Hampshire and Nigel Davenport.

results.title: It's a mad mad mad mad world
results.creator_credit: Stanley Kramer and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: A mammoth cast includes Spencer Tracy, Milton Berle, Sid Caeser, Buddy Hackett, Ethel Merman, Mickey Rooney, Dick Shawn, Phil Silvers, Terry Thomas, Jonathan Winters, Edie Adams, Dorothy Provine, Peter Falk and Jimmy Durante. Kramer’s film recalls the zany slapstick era of silent films. Durante is a dying millionaire who gives a secret clue to the location of his buried fortune. Everyone is out to beat everyone else to the loot and nothing is done in moderation. Every obstacle is put in the path of the treasure-seekers and dealt with in unexpected or illogical ways. With this bevy of comic actors, no single performance shines and the laughs abound.

results.title: How to marry a millionaire
results.creator_credit: Jean Negulesco, Nunnally Johnson and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Marilyn”.
Lauren Bacall, Betty Grable and Marilyn Monroe are three glamorous models on the lookout for a rich man. Pooling their funds, they decide to rent a luxurious Manhattan penthouse in order to lure their catch. Things are not what they appear to be as two of them fall in love with “poor men.” In the attempt to stop each other from marrying the wrong man, the threesome give their best performances. Utimately, it is love and not money which influences their choices. This film is a must see for lovers of Marilyn Monroe’s quirky and individualistic comedy style.

results.title: Malice
results.creator_credit: Harold Becker, Charles Mulvehill, Rachel Pfeffer, New Line Cinema and Castle Rock
results.brief_description: Dr. Jed Hill (Alec Baldwin) is an eminent doctor and the new head surgeon at Westerly Hospital. The newlywed Tracy Safian (Nicole Kidman) is admitted to hospital requiring emergency surgery. Dr. Hill defiantly performs an unnecessary operation which leaves her unable to have children. Hit with a $20 million dollar law suit, the truth begins to unravel - this is not the first time the medical whiz with miracle hands has played God, but will it be the last?

results.title: Gypsy
results.creator_credit: Orry-Kelly, Philip Anderson, Mervyn LeRoy and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Gypsy Rose Lee, burlesque Queen of renown, was driven to stardom much less by her own ambition, than by the ruthless determination of her mother. As the stereotypical domineering “stage mother”, Rosalind Russell’s performance is superb, while Karl Malden as her long-suffering but loyal lover also gives a fine performance. While the references to striptease are undeniably fleeting, Natalie Wood as Gypsy Rose Lee is creditable, but it is her vulnerability rather than her sex appeal which comes to the fore. Stephen Sondheim’s lyrics and Julie Styne’s score makes this a musical delight.

results.title: Paint your wagon
results.creator_credit: Joshua Logan, Alan Jay Lerner and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Lee Marvin and Clint Eastwood star in this famous film version of the the stage musical. Ben Rumson (Lee Marvin) is a hard-fighting, hard-drinking, happy-go-lucky man. His ‘Pardner’ (Clint Eastwood) on the other hand is sober, quiet and gentle. The story follows their adventures in a lawless gold mining town called No Name City (population: drunk). They stick together through thick and thin and share everything including a wife (Jean Seberg). Music and lyrics by Alan J. Lerner and Frederick Loewe

results.title: Miss Sadie Thompson
results.creator_credit: Curtis Bernhardt, Jerry Wald and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Adaptation of W. Somerset Maugham’s “Rain”, a steamy story of sex, sin and salvation in the tropics. Set in the 1940s, it is the story of a bawdy nightclub entertainer, Sadie (Rita Hayworth) and Alfred Davidson (Jose Ferrer), a puritanical preacher waging an anti-sin campaign in the Pacific Islands. When Sadie falls in love with a straight-arrow marine (Aldo Ray), she seeks Davidson’s help in reforming her life. Tragically, the repressed cleric reacts with disbelief and, ultimately violence.
